title: Pasta with Chickpeas
introduction: Pasta with Chickpeas, or Pasta e Ceci, is a hearty and flavorful Italian dish featuring a delicious combination of pasta and chickpeas in a savory tomato sauce. Topped with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, this meal is both comforting and nourishing. Adding pancetta and fresh sage elevates the dish, while a pinch of crushed red pepper brings a hint of spice. This recipe is sure to become a staple in your kitchen.
ingredients: 1 pound tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped
2 cups drained cooked or canned chickpeas
8 ounces small pasta, such as elbow or ditali
instructions: Pour the oil into a large saucepan. Add the pancetta and onion and cook, stirring occasionally, over medium heat, about 10 minutes or until tender and golden.
Add the tomatoes, 1/2 cup water, sage, red pepper, and salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Add the chickpeas and cook 10 minutes more.

Bring about 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot. Stir in 2 tablespoons of salt, then the pasta. Stir well. Cook, stirring frequently, until the pasta is tender yet firm to the bite. Set aside some of the cooking water. Drain the pasta.
Add the pasta to the pan with the sauce. Stir well and bring to a simmer, adding some of the cooking water if needed. Serve immediately.
